content.rendered:
Senior Schedule:

Monday, June 6: College/Career Dress
SENIOR SUNRISE

5:00a Students arrive at football field wearing College or Career”Gear”
5:16a Senior Sunrise commences, coffee provided

Discounts at Local Diners for Seniors!

Tuesday, June 7: Dress like a Senior Citizen
MEMORY WALL

Dress: white wigs, glasses, sneakers, suspenders, sweaters, etc.
Giant Poster Paper posted near Senior Lot area for students to post
favorite high school memories.  Will be displayed later at Senior Breakfast

Wednesday, June 8: Blue Streaks & Greeks
SENIOR SUMMER KICKOFF

Dress: InTogas or In Toga “Gear”
2:45p Senior v. Staff Kickball game and BBQ (Student Council)

Thursday, June 9: Dress like a Favorite Staff Member
THANK A STAFF MEMBER

Dress: Wear your favorite staff member’s”signature style”
All Day: Pickup a flower(donated by Dehn’sFlowers), fill out a thank you,
and deliver it to a staff member! *Free of charge to Seniors*

Friday, June 10: PJ Day

Dress: Wear your pajamas.
1st & 2nd Block: Senior Breakfast and Legacy Project, followed
by Guest Speakers

ATTENDANCE POLICY NOTICE

Students are welcome to stay for the entire school day

  • Students must have pre-authorized dismissal note to leave the school
    before 2:30.
  • Minimally, Saratoga Springs High School students are required to be in
    school through FLEX (11:07) on Friday, June 10th to be eligible to attend the Senior Gala.
  • Attendance will be verified for all students who wish to attend the Senior Gala.

EARLY DISMISSAL NOTES

  • The early dismissal note is required for all students, regardless of schedule or program in order to leave before the 2:30 dismissal time.
  • Written documentation from Parent/Guardian is required for early dismissal.
  • Bring written note to your Administrator’s office to be verified

OFF CAMPUS ACADEMIC PROGRAMS

  • All Seniors are invited to attend our Special Senior Breakfast and Guest Speakers scheduled for the morning of June 10th.
  • Alternatively, your attendance at your program will be verified and counted towards your attendance for June 10th.

Regardless of grade, program, or FLEX, students are required to be in attendance, following their specific schedule, to be eligible to attend the Senior Gala. If a student is ill and did not attend school on Friday, June 10th, they will also not attend the Senior Gala. June 10th.
